intro: Urtica thunbergiana subsp. dentata, commonly known as the serrated nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges, which are covered in fine stinging hairs. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties.
